column4: somebody help! i'm stuck in workspace 2 and I can't switch  back to the normal one :\
iirc the default binding is ctrl+alt+arrow left
i've tried that, but it's not working
or you can click in the pager thing on the panel (add one if it's not there)
my panel has disappeared too!
start a new one
how?
do you still have a terminal or a way to get one? Does alt+f2 still work?
yes, i have the run box
run gnome-panel
it doesn't bring up the panel
ugh. sec.
it did run the command, but i'm quite sure this workspace is not working how it should be, i think it's something to do with compiz-config
yeah, sounds like your wm is confused (the panel's still running, you just can't see it). Perhaps run "compiz --replace" or "metacity --replace"?
i did and now it lets me switch between workspaces, but the panel is still hidden
is there a command to show the panel?
I don't use gnome enough to find that one quickly
can you check if gnome-panel is running (launch gnome-system-monitor to check)
yes it is
the problem is I normally get at its configuration by right-clicking a blank spot on the panel, which is hard if there isn't one :)
it's just empty space and nothing happens when i right click anywhere on the background
i've just done gnome-panel --replace and it worked
my desktop's gone now, i can't see my icons
i'm just going to restart and see what's going on then, thank you for your help :)
